document_title: Psoriatic arthritis: Causes, symptoms, treatment and prevention
subsection_content:
Some factors that may increase the risk of psoriatic arthritis include:
Psoriasis: This is considered the biggest risk factor for developing the disease. Psoriasis patients with lesions on their nails have a very high chance of developing the disease.; Family history: Examination of the patient's personal and family medical history shows that many patients have parents, brothers, sisters and siblings with this disease.; Age: The disease can occur in all subjects and ages but is most common between 30 - 50 years old. (3)
